title: Event Time/Status Display
custom_preconds:
2018 Game States wiki: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/QAspace/2018+MLB+Game+States+and+Scenarios

See https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BP-4216 for all related tickets on how the Ballpark Guide event module will be populated

This test case is for confirming event status, additional details regarding layout and logos are covered in other cases.

Here are some samples of how this data will look when following in Charles:
PROD
http://www.ticketing-client.com/ticketing-client/json/EventTicketPromotion.tiksrv?team_id=121&team_xref_id=121&end_date=20180215&begin_date=20170216&display_in=ATBAT&site_section=Default&ticket_category=Tickets&offer_group=BALLPARKTAB&leave_empty_games=true&game_status=S&game_status=P&game_status=I&game_status=M&game_status=N&game_status=T&game_status=U&events=5
STAGING/BETA
http://www.ticketing-client.com/ticketing-client/json/EventTicketPromotion.tiksrv?team_id=121&team_xref_id=121&end_date=20180215&begin_date=20170216&display_in=ATBAT&site_section=Default&ticket_category=Tickets&offer_group=BALLPARKTABSTAGING&leave_empty_games=true&game_status=S&game_status=P&game_status=I&game_status=M&game_status=N&game_status=T&game_status=U&events=5
QA
http://qa.ticketing-client.com/ticketing-client/json/EventTicketPromotion.tiksrv?team_id=121&team_xref_id=121&end_date=20180215&begin_date=20170216&display_in=ATBAT&site_section=Default&ticket_category=Tickets&offer_group=BALLPARKTAB&leave_empty_games=true&game_status=S&game_status=P&game_status=I&game_status=M&game_status=N&game_status=T&game_status=U&events=5

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is still in preview state
AND the user looks at the game details in the upcoming event module on Ballpark Guide
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see the game time in upcoming event module

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is still in preview state and not the closest event and user swipes on the Upcoming Events module
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see the next event time in upcoming event module

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is still in preview state
AND the user looks at the game details on the ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see the game time in upcoming (next/today's) event of the ticket dashboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game has entered into a live state 
AND the user looks at the game details in the BPG upcoming event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will see both will be displaying 'Live' in place of the time

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in a 'Suspended' state
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN when the Event Module on the ballpark guide page will display 'Suspended'
AND the Tickets Dashboard event cell will also display 'Suspended'

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in a 'Delayed' state
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN when the Event Module on the ballpark guide page will display 'Delayed'
AND the Tickets Dashboard event cell will also display 'Delayed'

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in 'Final' state
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will NOT see game details for the game, the following event will now be shown in its place

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is part of a back to back double header and the user looks at the Upcoming Events module on BPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the game with a scheduled time first then the TBD game 2

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is part of a back to back double header and the user looks at the next/today's event on Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see game with a scheduled time

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is part of a split double header and the user looks at the Upcoming Events module on BPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the game with the earlier scheduled time first then game 2

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is part of a split double header and the user looks at the next/today's event on Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the game with the earlier scheduled time

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game has a start time of TBD and the user looks at the Upcoming Events module on BPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the game with TBD displayed instead of a time

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game has a start time of TBD and the user looks at the next/today's event on Ticket Dashboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the game with TBD displayed instead of a time

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user sets their device time zone to MT or PT and their time after 12:01 AM ET, and views the upcoming event module on the BPG of a team where the the game still in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will still see the game in Live status (it will not start showing the event for the following day)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user sets their device time zone to MT or PT and their time after 12:01 AM ET, and views the next/today's event on the Ticket Dashboard of a team where the the game still in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will still see the game in Live status (it will not start showing the event for the following day)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the event is a non game event
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the details will not change for any status

custom_steps_separated.content: When the event is a non game event of type "Z"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the time displayed will be text in the dynamic override field provided in the ticketing-client response (used for examples like Postseason games where the we want to show text in that space)

title: WHEN game is in preview state and user looks at game details on ballpark guide THEN user sees game time in upcoming event module
custom_steps:
WHEN a game is still in preview state
AND the user looks at the game details in the upcoming event module on Ballpark Guide
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the game time in upcoming event module

title: WHEN game is in preview state and is not the closest game THEN upon swiping the user sees next event time in upcoming event module
custom_steps: WHEN a game is still in preview state and not the closest event and user swipes on the Upcoming Events module
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the next event time in upcoming event module

title: WHEN game is in preview state THEN user will see game time in upcoming (next/today's) event of ticket dashboard
custom_steps:
WHEN a game is still in preview state
AND the user looks at the game details on the ticket dashboard
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the game time in upcoming (next/today's) event of the ticket dashboard

title: WHEN a game has entered into a live state THEN the user will see "LIVE" on both BPG upcoming event module and ticket dashboard
custom_steps:
WHEN a game has entered into a live state 
AND the user looks at the game details in the BPG upcoming event module and ticket dashboard
custom_expected: THEN the user will see both will be displaying 'Live' in place of the time

title: WHEN game is in a suspended state THEN user will see "Suspended" display on both event module on BPG page and tickets dashboard event cell
custom_steps: WHEN a game is in a "Suspended" state
custom_expected:
THEN when the Event Module on the ballpark guide page will display "Suspended"
AND the Tickets Dashboard event cell will also display 'Suspended'

title: WHEN game is in a delayed state THEN user will see "Delayed" display on both event module on BPG page and tickets dashboard event cell
custom_steps: When a game is in a "Delayed" state
custom_expected:
THEN when the Event Module on the ballpark guide page will display "Delayed"
AND the Tickets Dashboard event cell will also display "Delayed"

title: WHEN a game is in "Final" state THEN user will NOT see game details for that game and the following event will show in its place
custom_steps: WHEN a game is in "Final" state
custom_expected: THEN the user will NOT see game details for the game, the following event will now be shown in its place

title: WHEN viewing upcoming events module on BPG and the game is a back to back doubleheader THEN user will schedule time first and then TBD game 2
custom_steps: WHEN a game is part of a back to back doubleheader and the user looks at the Upcoming Events module on BPG
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the game with a scheduled time first then the TBD game 2

title: User will see game with a scheduled time WHEN game is part of back to back double header and user looks at next/today's event on ticket dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN a game is part of a back to back doubleheader and the user looks at the next/today's event on Ticket Dashboard
custom_expected: THEN the user will see game with a scheduled time

title: WHEN game is part of split doubleheader and user views upcoming events module on BPG THEN user will see earlier scheduled time first and then game 2
custom_steps: WHEN a game is part of a split doubleheader and the user looks at the Upcoming Events module on BPG
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the game with the earlier scheduled time first then game 2

title: WHEN a game is part of a split double header and user views next/today's event on ticket dashboard THEN user sees game with earlier scheduled time
custom_steps: WHEN a game is part of a split doubleheader and the user looks at the next/today's event on Ticket Dashboard
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the game with the earlier scheduled time

title: WHEN a game has a start time of TBD THEN user sees TBD instead of time when viewing upcoming events module on BPG
custom_steps: WHEN a game has a start time of TBD and the user looks at the Upcoming Events module on BPG
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the game with TBD displayed instead of a time

title: WHEN a game has start time TBD and user views next/today's event on ticket dashboard THEN TBD is displayed instead of time
custom_steps: WHEN a game has a start time of TBD and the user looks at the next/today's event on Ticket Dashboard
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the game with TBD displayed instead of a time

title: User should see game in LIVE status and not show events for following day if user sets their device time zone to MT or PT
custom_steps: WHEN the user sets their device time zone to MT or PT and their time after 12:01 AM ET, and views the upcoming event module on the BPG of a team where the game still in progress
custom_expected: THEN the user will still see the game in Live status (it will not start showing the event for the following day)

title: User should see game in LIVE status and not show events for the following day if user sets their device time zone to MT or PT and views next/today's event on ticket dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN the user sets their device time zone to MT or PT and their time after 12:01 AM ET and views the next/today's event on the Ticket Dashboard of a team where the game still in progress
custom_expected: THEN the user will still see the game in Live status (it will not start showing the event for the following day)

title: WHEN the event is non game event THEN details will not change for any status
custom_steps: WHEN an event is a nongame event
custom_expected: THEN the details will not change for any status
